summary: A submission email to the Royal Commission in Australia from an individual alleging misconduct by Bond University Limited and the Australian legal profession, including exploitation, abuse, and financial harm. The sender details personal grievances and seeks criminal, civil, and financial recourse.

persons.name: Ronald Sackville
persons.context: Addressed as the recipient of the submission email, serving as the chair of an Australian Royal Commission.

persons.name: Alan Finch
persons.role: Executive Management at Bond University Limited
persons.context: Named as part of Bond University's executive management who allegedly misled the sender.

persons.name: Michael Dean
persons.role: Executive Management at Bond University Limited
persons.context: Named as part of Bond University's executive management who allegedly misled the sender.

persons.name: Tim Brailsford
persons.role: Executive Management at Bond University Limited
persons.context: Named as part of Bond University's executive management who allegedly misled the sender.

persons.name: Kirsty Mitchell
persons.role: Career Adviser Director at Bond University Limited
persons.context: Named as the career adviser director at Bond University who allegedly misled the sender.

connections.description: Both are named as executive management staff at Bond University Limited who allegedly misled the sender.
Both are named as staff at Bond University Limited involved in alleged misconduct against the sender.

events.title: Period of alleged misconduct and exploitation
events.description: The sender alleges being abused, exploited, misled, and unable to secure proper employment by Bond University and the legal profession over this 15-year period.

events.title: Submission to Royal Commission
events.description: The sender emails a submission to the Royal Commission detailing grievances and seeking recourse against Bond University and the Australian legal profession.

keyFacts: The sender alleges widespread misconduct by Australian universities and the legal profession, including exploitation, abuse, and misleading practices.
Specific Bond University staff (Alan Finch, Michael Dean, Tim Brailsford, Kirsty Mitchell) are accused of misleading the sender.
The sender claims principals and partners of law firms engage in drug use and sexual misconduct with young legal professionals.
The submission seeks criminal, civil, and financial recourse against Bond University Limited and the Australian legal profession.
The sender states they and their parents spent close to a million dollars on education between 2004-2019 with little professional return.
